org.parboiled.support
Class InputLocation

java.lang.Object
  org.parboiled.support.InputLocation

public class InputLocation
extends Object

(Almost) immutable descriptor for a certain position in an InputBuffer. The InputLocations corresponding to one input text form a simple linked list.

Constructor Summary
InputLocation(InputBuffer inputBuffer)

Returns:
the input character at this location

getNext

public InputLocation getNext()
Returns the next input location if it has already been fetched, or null if this location is the last location in the underlying InputBuffer that was looked at during the current parsing run.

Returns:
the next input location or null

advance

public InputLocation advance(@NotNull
                             InputBuffer inputBuffer)
Fetches and returns the input location after this one in the given InputBuffer. If this is already the input location at EOI the method return this instance.

Parameters:
inputBuffer - the input buffer
Returns:
the following input location or this if already at EOI

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

removeNext

@NotNull
public InputLocation removeNext()
"Cuts out" and returns the next input location from the chain of InputLocations. Neither this nor the next InputLocation must be the last InputLocation in the chain. This operation does not change the underlying InputBuffer.

Returns:
the InputLocation that was cut out.

insertNext

public void insertNext(@NotNull
                       InputLocation nextLocation)
Inserts the given InputLocation as the next input location into the chain. Useful for reversing a previous removeNext() operation. This operation does not change the underlying InputBuffer.

Parameters:
nextLocation - the location to insert.

insertNext

public void insertNext(char character)
Inserts a virtual character into the input stream without changing the underlying InputBuffer. This instance must not be the last InputLocation fetched so far.

Parameters:
character - the char to insert
